|rad1oui = |rad1_ant_conn = Murata SWG MM8030-2610 |rad1txchains = 2 |rad1rxchains = 2 |rad1sstreams = 2 |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b/g/n/ax |axqam1 = |rad1ax = 574 |nqam1 = |rad1n = 300 |rad1g = 54 |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4 |wi2_if_name = |rad2mod = |rad2modif = unknown |rad2chip1 = Qualcomm;IPQ5010; |rad2oui = |rad2_ant_conn = Murata SWG MM8030-2610 |rad2txchains = 2 |rad2rxchains = 2 |rad2sstreams = 2 |rad2stand = IEEE 802.11a/n/ac/ax |axqam2 = 2402 |rad2ax = 1201 |acqam2 = |rad2ac = 867 |rad2n = 300 |rad2a = 54 |rad2freq = 5 }}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== The information on this page was mainly obtained [https://boxmatrix.info/wiki/FRITZ!Repeater_1200_AX from BoxMatrix]. That website also contains (copyrighted) PCB pictures. There's also a [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GcCuKLYxcNY video/discussion of this disassembly on Youtube]. A modification kit with a case extension, RP-SMA pigtails and a pair of external antennae is [https://frixtender.de/kompatibilitaet-des-fritzrepeater-1200-ax/ available from Frixtender]. That site also has additional PCB pictures. ==Links of Interest== * [https://en.avm.de/produkte/fritzwlan/fritzrepeater-1200-ax/details/ Vendor's product details page] * [https://en.avm.de/products/fritzwlan/fritzrepeater-1200-ax/technical-specifications/ Vendor's technical specifications page] * [https://ftp.avm.de/fritzwlan/fritzrepeater-1200-ax/ Vendor's firmware image download page] * [https://osp.avm.de/fritzwlan/fritzrepeater-1200-ax/ Vendor's GPL tarball download page] ==JTAG-Serial Info== '''Warning''': Be extremely careful when disassembling the device and connecting to pins. The lower PCB is connected to mains, only lies loosely on top of two metal spring contacts that '''directly expose mains voltage'''. This means that even a minor misalignment of the PCBs within the back/lower half of the plastic casing could result in '''shorting out mains''' power, '''destroying your device''' or giving you a '''life-threatening electric shock'''. ===JTAG=== ====JTAG Pinouts==== The unpopulated 10-pin JTAG-like SMT pin header has not been tested thus far. ===Serial=== ====Serial Pinouts==== The unpopulated 4-pin 0.1" THT pin header next to the LAN port is a UART console to the Eva_AVM bootloader console that uses a voltage of 1.8V, a baud rate of 115200 and the following pinout: 
[o] VCC (do not connect!)
(o) RX
(o) TX
(o) Ground
[[Category:English Documentation]]
